title: 1893–94 in Scottish football
text:
1893–94 in Scottish football was the 21st season of competitive <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> in Scotland and the fourth season of <a href="Scotland">Scottish</a> league <a href="Football%20%28soccer%29">football</a>. For the first time there were two divisions in the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish Football League</a>, there was no automatic promotion and relegation but the bottom three clubs in <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League%20First%20Division">Division One</a> and the top three clubs in <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League%20Second%20Division">Division Two</a> were subject to a vote of the remaining First Division clubs. This season also saw the introduction of the <a href="Highland%20Football%20League">Highland Football League</a>.
Scottish Division One.
<a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a> became <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League%20First%20Division">Scottish Division One</a> champions for the second year in a row, after defeating <a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a> 3–2 at <a href="Celtic%20Park">Celtic Park</a> on 24 February 1894. <a href="Renton%20F.C.">Renton</a> were relegated, <a href="Dundee%20F.C.">Dundee</a> and <a href="Leith%20Athletic%20F.C.">Leith Athletic</a> re-elected to Division One.
Scottish Division Two.
<a href="Clyde%20F.C.">Clyde</a> were elected to Division One, <a href="Hibernian%20F.C.">Hibernian</a> and <a href="Cowlairs%20F.C.">Cowlairs</a> remained in the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League%20Second%20Division">Scottish Division Two</a>. 
<a href="Port%20Glasgow%20Athletic%20F.C.">Port Glasgow Athletic</a> were docked seven points for fielding an ineligible player.
Scottish Cup.
<a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a> were winners of the <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a> after a 3–1 victory over rivals <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a> in an <a href="Old%20Firm">Old Firm</a> final at <a href="Cathkin%20Park">Hampden Park</a>.
Junior Cup.
<a href="Ashfield%20F.C.">Ashfield</a> were winners of the <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Cup">Junior Cup</a> after a 3–0 win over Renfrew V.
Scotland national team.
<a href="Scotland%20national%20football%20team">Scotland</a> were winners of the <a href="British%20Home%20Championship">British Home Championship</a> in 1894 after pipping <a href="England%20national%20football%20team">England</a> to the trophy.
Key:
